BiblioData.Title: METHOD FOR METAL- FREE SYNTHESIS OF EPITAXIAL SEMICONDUCTOR NANOWIRES ON SI
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention relates to epitaxial growth of nanowires on a substrate. In particular the invention relates to growth of nanowires on an Si-substrate without using Au as a catalyst. In the method according to the invention an oxide template is provided on a passivated surface of the substrate. The oxide template defines a plurality of nucleation onset positions for subsequent nanowire growth. According to one embodiment a thin organic film is used to form the oxide template.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
1. A method of producing nanostructured devices comprising a nanowire epitaxially grown from a surface of a substrate, the method characterized by the steps of:

-(a) hydrogen termination of the surface of the substrate (100) to provide a substrate with a temporarily passivated surface (110); -(b) providing an oxide template (115) on the passivated surface (110) of the substrate (105), the oxide template defining a plurality of nucleation onset positions for the subsequent nanowire growth; and
-(c) growing nanowires in the nucleation onset positions defined by the oxide template on the substrate surface (110).
2. The method according to claim 1, wherein the structure of the oxide template (115) is self-assembled.

3. The method according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the oxide template forms a growth inhibiting mask of primarily Si[theta]2 with holes, or weakenings in the mask forming the nucleation onset positions.
4. The method according to claim 3, wherein in the growing step, nanowires nucleate and grow in the holes or weakenings of the growth inhibiting mask.

6. The method according to claim 5, wherein the thin organic film forms a plurality of localized areas with increased permeability.
7. The method according to claim 5, wherein in the thin organic film is formed a plurality of cracks.
8. The method according to claim 6 or 7, wherein a localized oxidation on the surface of the substrate occur at the areas with increased permeability or at the cracks.
